translation.en: Where go you, my friend?
You're crawling in the wrong direction.
That wind you feel is coming from England.
translation.ja: これはイングランドの風

translation.en: Scotland's that way.
translation.ja: スコットランドは向こうだ

translation.en: My lords. I'm most sorry for making you wait.
translation.ja: ノーサンバランド伯待たせてすまない

translation.en: I know you've traveled far and from great travail.
translation.ja: 苦難の長旅であったな

translation.en: I pray you will know that this time of civil unrest...
consumes me... day and night.
translation.ja: 昼夜を問わず私を消耗させる

translation.en: I understand... battle with the rebel Scots was hard fought.
translation.ja: スコットランド反乱軍との戦いは熾烈だった

translation.en: It was, my liege. -We lost some 300 men. -[exhales deeply]
translation.ja: はい　陛下我々は300人を失いました

translation.en: Good Hotspur...
you led the charge. Were any prisoners of note taken?
Many.
-Are they in train? -No.
And why is that? Why have they not been brought to me directly?
translation.ja: なぜだ？なぜ私に引き渡さぬ？

translation.en: Why will you not pay cousin Mortimer's ransom?
translation.ja: モーティマーの身代金を

translation.en: You'll need to speak up, my boy.
I'm an old man. My ears... are filled with hair.
translation.ja: 私は老いぼれだ耳が毛で塞がっとる

translation.en: Cousin Mortimer is held by the rebels of Wales.  Why do you refuse to pay his ransom?
translation.ja: なぜ敵の手にある彼の身代金を払わぬのです？

translation.en: I refuse to pay Mortimer's ransom because I refuse to believe him a prisoner.
translation.ja: 私は奴を捕虜だとは思わぬ

translation.en: I rather believe Mortimer a traitor.
He has joined the Welsh rebels.
He has betrayed England and is now an enemy of mine, and, therefore, of yours.
translation.ja: イングランドを裏切り今や私とお前の敵だ

translation.en: You agree with my précis, young Hotspur?
-No. -[Northumberland] My son--
I believe yours to be the ramblings of a crazy old demon.
translation.ja: まるで悪魔の戯言(ざれごと)だ

translation.en: Harry, please, stop this.
[King Henry IV] Oh, no, let him speak.
-I wish to hear him. -[Northumberland] My liege--
Yours are the ramblings of an old man so saturated with malice and mistrust that he no longer knows up from down,
translation.ja: 今のお言葉は悪意と不信に満ちた老人の戯言

translation.en: can no longer see beyond the walls of his own monstrous schloss.
translation.ja: 城壁の向こうが見えてない

translation.en: My family have served you. We aided you in your ascension, and still we fight for you.
translation.ja: 私の家族は陛下に仕えそして戦ってる

translation.en: Cousin Mortimer has fought for you.
And yet, now, whilst you slobber over that chicken's wing, he shivers in a western prison awaiting mutilation at the hands of Welsh witches.
translation.ja: 陛下が鶏を食してるとき彼は牢獄で死を待っている

translation.en: [Northumberland] My liege...
you must excuse my son. He needs rest.
translation.ja: せがれを許してください休養が必要だ

translation.en: We come only... to advocate for your help in securing Mortimer's release.
translation.ja: 我々は ただ彼の解放を願い助けを求めているだけです

translation.en: All that we've done for you we have done for the good of England. But our lands are now more riven with war than ever before.
translation.ja: 国のための戦(いくさ)が今や国土を戦火にさらしてる

translation.en: The Scots aren't finished. The Welsh have only just begun. And for what?
translation.ja: ウェールズとも開戦した

translation.en: Why do you think this might be, old man?
Who do you imagine might be to blame for this?
Chickens can't fly.
But I've seen one... eke enough wing flap to clear a fence.
translation.ja: 私は柵を飛び越えた鶏を見たことがある

translation.en: Then it's free.
But then so too are the foxes.
translation.ja: だが外には狐(きつね)が

translation.en: You are right, young Percy. I owe you much.
I owe your family still more.
But if the Scottish traitors you've taken prisoner are not brought to me as speedily as they might travel,
translation.ja: だがスコットランドの捕虜を速やかに引き渡さんと―

translation.en: I will hang you by your fucking neck.
Has this been heard, young Percy?
Your Majesty, please forgive us.
translation.ja: 陛下　どうかお許しください

translation.en: What a venomous boy.
He'll betray me now. I'm sure of it.
If only he were my son.
[Falstaff] Hal.
[Falstaff] Hal?
-[Falstaff grunts] -What is it?
Falstaff has injured hisself.
Yeah. See?
-How did you get inside? -[Falstaff] The door was ajar.
It was not.
[Falstaff] Yes, it was. It was ajar.
It was not ajar.
Well, how else might we gain entry?
Are you accusing me of having cut myself a secret key?
Falstaff has injured hisself, Hal. Will you perform the small repairs?
translation.ja: 怪我してる 彼の手当てを

translation.en: No.
Your Highness.
[grunts] There's a fresh coin in this for you, you know.
I don't want your coin. I will require your undiminished loyalty from here till Megiddo.
translation.ja: それより お前の変わらぬ忠誠心が欲しい

translation.en: You have that already. You're a soft negotiator.
translation.ja: お前への忠誠はすでに誓ってる

translation.en: [yelps] Hey! You're wasting good wine.
-I'm keeping it clean. -Give it.
Oh. That looks very hot.
[Falstaff] Do it.
Prince Henry.
Who are you?
We come from the royal court. We wish to speak with you privately.
translation.ja: 王宮の者です　内密でお話が

translation.en: For what?
Please, sire. Privately.
Oh, privately, in the middle of Eastcheap?
translation.ja: このイーストチープで？

translation.en: Should I make a quick up and down and request a mass covering of ears?
translation.ja: 奴らに耳を塞げと頼もうか？

translation.en: Please, sire.
What is this?
Your father, His Majesty King--
Your father, His Majesty King Henry, is ill.
He requests your presence.
Hmm. I suggest you return to the palace directly and tell him his request was wholly ignored.
translation.ja: 王宮に戻って帰還は叶わぬと伝えろ

translation.en: I've been instructed to deliver the request with great urgency.
You might tell him the urgency was also wholly ignored.
translation.ja: 緊急も叶わぬと伝えろ

translation.en: [whispers] My lady. My lady, it's time to leave.
translation.ja: お嬢さん　帰る時間だ

translation.en: -Why? -[shushes]
The day has begun. See? -Out there. -[small exhale]
It is well underway. -[groans] -You might miss it.
translation.ja: 今日も いい日になりそうだ

translation.en: Get up now. It's important that you leave.
translation.ja: さあ起きろ　帰るんだ

translation.en: -Up. That's the spirit. -[groans]
Right.
Now, lift your arms.
Very good.
You must get that door fixed.
What is it?
Visit with your father.
Go away.
If your father is indeed gravely ill enough to request your presence, then you must visit with him.
translation.ja: お前を呼ぶほど重病なら父上を訪ねるべきだ

translation.en: It should be better to regret having done so than it would to have not.
translation.ja: あとで後悔しても知らんぞ

translation.en: If your father is ill, no matter your feelings for him, you must visit with him.
translation.ja: わだかまりを捨てて父上に会ってこい

translation.en: I say this not out of concern for our king's well-being,
translation.ja: お前が父上の召喚を無視し―

translation.en: but more for fear of the drunken soak to which you'll be likely to succumb
translation.ja: 和解もせぬまま父上が死んでしまったら―

translation.en: should you fail to heed his call and he were to die
translation.ja: 和解もせぬまま父上が死んでしまったら― お前は酒浸りになってしまう

translation.en: without you having squared your ledger.
translation.ja: お前は酒浸りになってしまう

translation.en: I fear that would be soak enough to put even me to shame.
translation.ja: 俺だって悪酔いしちまうよ

translation.en: Do it. If nothing else I ever suggest.
translation.ja: 行け　これが俺の助言だ

translation.en: [archbishop] While I see the strain your treasury is under,
translation.ja: 国庫の困窮を勘案すると―

translation.en: I cannot help but wonder if the canker of Lollardy
translation.ja: ロラード派の汚職こそ諸悪の根源です

translation.en: be at the root of this suggestion that the church be burdened with a tax
translation.ja: ロラード派の汚職こそ諸悪の根源です 教会は いわれのない問題に税金を払っている

translation.en: to relieve problems that are not of the church's making.
translation.ja: 教会は いわれのない問題に税金を払っている

translation.en: Your Majesty. Henry, Prince of Wales.
translation.ja: 陛下　ヘンリー王子です

translation.en: [King Henry IV] My son. Come in.
I feel my life nearing its natural end, and yet, still...
translation.ja: 人生の終わりが近づいてるのに―

translation.en: even I must appear of ruder health than you.
translation.ja: こうして強靭を装っておる

translation.en: The time has come for us to consider... the issue of...
translation.ja: わが継承問題を考えるときが―

translation.en: my succession.
You will not be king.
While you are my eldest son,
for reasons that are on display for all here to see, smell...
translation.ja: ここにいる全ての者が納得する理由で―

translation.en: you will not inherit this crown.
Nor have I sought it.
That privilege and responsibility  will instead fall to your brother Thomas.
translation.ja: 王としての特権と責任は弟のトマスに与える

translation.en: He is soft, but he is eager.
translation.ja: トマスは未熟だが貪欲だ

translation.en: He will lead my army against the newly treasonous Harry Percy.
translation.ja: 軍を率いてホットスパーを討つ

translation.en: I will assume that this news comes as neither surprise nor disappointment.
translation.ja: この知らせは驚きでも失望でもないだろう

translation.en: But it is my duty as king, and father...
translation.ja: しかし私は王として父としての義務から―

translation.en: to say it to you directly.
When do you fight?
I set off tomorrow.
We fight by week's end.
You need not fight. These feuds need not be yours.
translation.ja: 戦う必要はないお前とは無縁の確執だ

translation.en: [King Henry IV] I have said... what you were summonsed to hear.
translation.ja: お前は召喚され私の告知を聞いた

translation.en: Leave us now.
-Your Highness. -Stop.
-Your Highness. -Stop.
Lord Dorset.
Are your men ready for the day?
They are, sire.
Very good.
Tell me of your preparations.
My lord.
Why are you here?
I will not allow this havoc to transpire.  I've come to see it stopped.
translation.ja: 大惨事が起こるのを止めるためだ

translation.en: This is my battle.
If I have my way, there will be no battle.
You. Come here.
-[man] My lord. -You have no place here.
Go to the rebel camp, deliver the following message to Percy Hotspur.
translation.ja: 反乱軍のホットスパーに使者を

translation.en: Tell him that Prince Henry challenges him to settle today's score man on man. He and I.
translation.ja: 私は彼に一対一の決闘を申し込む

translation.en: We will fight in our armies' places.
Yes, my lord.
Who do you think you are?
I am nobody to you.
I will fight him. And I will defeat him.
translation.ja: 彼と戦う　そして倒す

translation.en: That you surely would, my son.
But it cannot be. The prince speaks not for his father.
translation.ja: それでは王を倒したことにならん

translation.en: You are eager to fight, my son.
translation.ja: 戦こそ お前の本分

translation.en: And you will.
And we shall fight alongside you.
We will burn them.
We will burn Henry's reign to the ground.
translation.ja: ヘンリーの治世は灰燼(かいじん)と化す

translation.en: -[Thomas] You have no place here. -You do not know war, Thomas.
translation.ja: 帰れ お前は戦を知らん

translation.en: -I do know war. -[Hal] You do not.
translation.ja: 知ってる 知らない

translation.en: You've been recruited to our father's madness, to wars that need not be fought.
translation.ja: お前は父上のせいで無益な戦に駆り出された

translation.en: These men are not our enemies.
translation.ja: 彼らは敵ではない父上が追い込んだ

translation.en: -Our father has made them thus. -[Thomas] Why then are you here?
translation.ja: 彼らは敵ではない父上が追い込んだ 兄上は―

translation.en: You so disapprove of our cause, and yet, still, you find it necessary to upstage me.
translation.ja: 異を唱えながら私を出し抜こうとしてる

translation.en: I do this not to steal your thunder, brother.  I do it to save your life.
translation.ja: 私は手柄などいらん助けたいだけだ

translation.en: [man] Pardon me, my lords.
Our herald is returned from the rebel camp.
They have refused Prince Henry's offer.
They want battle.
Where is Henry?
I come to fight him in our armies' stead.
No. His offer was refused.
translation.ja: だめだ　貴方(あなた)は拒否した

translation.en: The offer has been reconsidered.
I said... [shouts] no!
translation.ja: だめなものは だめだ！

translation.en: Why is the little dog barking?
[yells] Where be the big dog?
It will be done.
And here I am with the whoring fool.
This fight need not be had, Percy.
My father will soon be dead. Your grievances will die with him.
translation.ja: 父の死で怒りは消える

translation.en: Don't be afraid of our small contest, young Hal.
translation.ja: 怖気づくなよ　ハル

translation.en: I promise to finish it quickly.
Your father... is plague to England.
translation.ja: お前の父親はわが国の疫病だ

translation.en: Come for me, big dog!
translation.ja: 犬め　かかってこい

translation.en: Someday this will be your head, dropped at the feet of a man who might otherwise have been your brother.
translation.ja: いつか お前の首が足元に転がるぞ

translation.en: Come with me now, Thomas, please. Walk away from this field.
translation.ja: 一緒に来い戦場から去るのだ

translation.en: After you have stolen its prized scalp?
This is what will be spoken of tomorrow.
translation.ja: 明日には決着がついてた

translation.en: [sighs] This field was mine.
It was to mark my dominion.
Instead now...  it marks only this head.
translation.ja: それが今は この首一つ

translation.en: This fucking head!
Move.
-[Hooper] John. -[groans]
John.
Go away.
You might want to see to your otherwise well-appointed friend.
translation.ja: 可愛い友人が帰ってきたよ

translation.en: He seems to have taken a pitiful turn.
[whispers] Beale.
Hal's up-chucked again.
Hello, friend.
Many times have I seen men in your state.
translation.ja: 何度も こんな男を見たよ

translation.en: I've been in it many times over myself.
For all our rejoice of... courage and valor,
translation.ja: 武勇の誉れとはいえ殺戮ほど―

translation.en: nothing stains the soul more indelibly than killing.
translation.ja: 魂に刻み込まれる汚れはない

translation.en: Never have I felt so vile... than standing victorious on a battlefield.
translation.ja: 戦場で勝利を収めるほど不快感は増していく

translation.en: The thrill of victory fades quickly.
translation.ja: 勝利の高揚は すぐに消える

translation.en: What lingers long after... is always ugly.
translation.ja: いつまでも残るのは常に醜さだけ

translation.en: Never again, I say.
[Hal] Stop talking, old man, please.
Please stop talking.
I will never stop talking, Hal.
translation.ja: 話すのは やめんぞ

translation.en: Never.
Never ever.
[William] Out.
[William] My lord.
What business?
[William] It is a matter of great urgency.
Mm. You should hurry along then.
Please, my lord. It is your father.
He's dying.
Hmm, that hook has lost its worm.
[William] Wait outside.
No doubt...
your father has brought... much trouble to this kingdom,
translation.ja: 多くの問題をもたらしたのは間違いないこと

translation.en: and I fear the chaos that might erupt in his absence.
translation.ja: しかし王の不在が混乱を招く恐れが

translation.en: England needs a king, and I suspect those sentiments of yours
translation.ja: イングランドには王が必要であります

translation.en: that had you resile from him are precisely those the governance of this land needs.
translation.ja: 殿下の信念こそ国の統治にふさわしいもの

translation.en: You must be king.
Why do you say this to me? Speak to Thomas.
translation.ja: なぜ私に言う？トマスに話せ

translation.en: Is he not to be your new king?
I'm afraid that is not possible.
Your brother was killed in Wales.
translation.ja: ウェールズで殺されました

translation.en: After you defeated Percy Hotspur,
young Thomas pressed on to the western fields.
translation.ja: トマス王子は西を目指しました

translation.en: This is where he met his end.
It is said he gave valiant account of himself.
translation.ja: 勇敢な最期だったとか

translation.en: [Hal yells] Where is he?! Where is the monster?!
translation.ja: どこにいる？怪物はどこだ？

translation.en: Where is the monster?
Move. Leave him.
The King needs rest.
-Soon he will have it. -He's dying.
Leave.
You feel this cold?
-Wretch. -[whimpers]
[weakly] Hal.
You must be king, Hal.
translation.ja: ハル　お前が王になれ

translation.en: Please.
You must be king, Hal.
You know not what will become of you.
translation.ja: この先 不安だろう

translation.en: So, I offer you this...
The most blessed reprieve,
the most dreadful misery.
You shall suffer the indignity of serving me,
the wayward son you so revile.
But know now you will be watched over by an altogether different king.
translation.ja: だが諸君は新王に見守られる

translation.en: What is this?
Who are you?
I am I. Who are you?
translation.ja: 俺は俺だ　お前こそ誰だ？

translation.en: [Lord Chamberlain] What is your purpose here?
I think you just woke me up from it, didn't you?
Rise from that bed at once.
Who are you? Where is Hal?
translation.ja: お前は誰だ？ハルはどこにいる？

translation.en: These lodgings and their contents are the property of the King of England.
translation.ja: この宿屋は国王の所有物だ

translation.en: You are trespassing and I order you to vacate at once.
translation.ja: 不法侵入者はただちに立ち去れ

translation.en: What King of England?
[archbishop] All hail King Henry.
[crowd] King Henry!
King Henry! King Henry!
King Wenceslaus of Bohemia presents this gift to King Henry of England. To long and good health.
translation.ja: ヴァーツラフ王よりご健勝を祈る贈り物です

translation.en: Beautiful.
I'm sure you all know... my young sister Philippa has joined us here today. Queen of Denmark.
translation.ja: デンマーク女王である妹のフィリッパがいる

translation.en: I'm thankful she and her husband,
the good King Eric, have traveled all this way.
I wish for you take this vase, my dear.
translation.ja: この花瓶を進呈しよう

translation.en: Let its beauty stand for your beauty, which stands in turn for England's beauty.
translation.ja: そなたの美はイングランドの美である

translation.en: I thank you, my lord.
[Lord Chamberlain] His Serenity, the doge of the Republic of Venice,
translation.ja: ヴェネツィア共和国元首の敬意を表しての―

translation.en: present this gift in your honor, my liege.
-It says it is a bird from Constantinople. -[King Henry V] A bird?
translation.ja: コンスタンチノープルの鳥 鳥？　死んだ鳥か？

translation.en: A dead one, I should suppose.
If I may, my liege.
Unnatural mechanics from the edge of Christendom.
translation.ja: キリスト教世界の不思議な装置ですな

translation.en: [King Henry V] A wonder.
This belongs to my cousin, Cambridge.
Of all at this table, none have I known longer than I have you.
translation.ja: 私は誰よりも長く貴方を知ってる

translation.en: Indeed I have known you longer than I have my own young sister.
translation.ja: 妹よりも長いぐらいだ

translation.en: We were raised together. You're like an older brother to me.
translation.ja: 貴方は私にとって兄も同然

translation.en: So, I think it only fitting that you should have this magical bird.
translation.ja: この魔法の鳥を飼うべきだ

translation.en: Let's hope its magic isn't black and unholy.
translation.ja: 黒魔術でないことを祈ろう

translation.en: [Lord Chamberlain] From the Dauphin, son of His Majesty, Charles, King of France.
translation.ja: フランス王シャルル陛下の皇太子より

translation.en: A ball.
There is no accompanying message from the Dauphin?
No, my liege.
I shall keep this gift.
This one is sent only for me.
For the boy I once was.
The ball is an insult to you and to your kingdom.
translation.ja: これは陛下と国を侮辱するもの

translation.en: You must respond.
Remember where, as prince, I whiled and how I spent my days?
translation.ja: 私には無軌道な日々があった

translation.en: [William] You spent them in considered privation.
Drinking, clowning.
So, is there not some truth in this jest?
If the Dauphin wants from me a paroxysm, why give it him?
translation.ja: 挑発なら乗ることはない

translation.en: It would not be a show of foul temper for you to respond forcefully to an insult such as that.
translation.ja: 侮辱に反応するのは激情にかられるのとは違う

translation.en: It would be a show of strength.
I appreciate your umbrage, William,
but my strength does not lie in me flapping up and down at the slightest barb like...
translation.ja: しかし私の強さはこんな小さな棘(とげ)で―

translation.en: -some unholy mechanical bird. -Mm.
Make sense of this. This is what is pressing.
translation.ja: それより これが急務だ

translation.en: Civil strife has consumed us.
The war drains the purse like little else.
translation.ja: 戦争は財政を圧迫します

translation.en: This strife must end.
And it will end... by conciliation.
We shall pardon our adversaries.
And we shall pay Mortimer's ransom and have him returned from Wales.
translation.ja: モーティマーの身代金を払おう

translation.en: I will write these pardons in mine own hand.
I want it known these sentiments are so personal to me.
translation.ja: 私には個人的な思いが

translation.en: We shall let these men know they were my father's enemies, not mine.
translation.ja: 彼らは父の敵であって私の敵ではない

translation.en: [William] Certainly, my liege.
How does this strategy greet you?
Great reforms are best enacted with regime change.
translation.ja: 改革は政権交代で成されます

translation.en: If this is how you wish to proceed, then, yes, my liege,  now is the time to do it.
translation.ja: これが陛下の歩む道なら今こそが進むべきとき

translation.en: Did you reconcile with our father before his death?
translation.ja: 父上と和解したのですか？

translation.en: There was no reconciliation to be had.
He did untold harm to this kingdom. His death will bring calm with it.
translation.ja: 父上は国に痛手を死が平穏をもたらすだろう

translation.en: I ask not after the kingdom. What of you?
translation.ja: 兄上は この混乱をどうしたいのです？

translation.en: I want an end to this unrest.
Look around that table last night.
Look at the faces of the men seated at it.
translation.ja: あの方たちのお顔ときたら

translation.en: I can feel this calm of which you speak.
I do believe they wish you well.
But I also see that they have their own kingdoms behind their eyes.
translation.ja: でも彼らには彼ら自身の王国があります

translation.en: Do you understand what I say?
I've been away too many years and I'm now to return to Denmark.
translation.ja: 祖国を離れて何年もたちますが―

translation.en: But I have, in my time in that court, been privy to its commissions.
translation.ja: 王宮にいた頃は暗黙の了解がありました

translation.en: I have seen there, again and again, that no one ever speaks true, wholly true.
translation.ja: ここでは誰ひとりとして真実を語りません

translation.en: Choose your steps wisely, dear brother.
translation.ja: どうぞ賢く道を選んでください

translation.en: [archbishop] I speak to Charles of France's claim to be the legitimate sovereign ruler of said lands.
translation.ja: フランス王シャルルは正当な主権者だと主張

translation.en: It is said that the Salic law would have no succession
translation.ja: サリカ法によって女子の王位継承を―

translation.en: if the French crown fall to a woman.
Meaning, no rule left in the lineage of the female shall, by rights, pass to her issue.
translation.ja: つまり女子の血統に残された道はありません

translation.en: Now, the law Salic, which is of Frankish land
translation.ja: サリカ法ですが― サリカ国はフランク族の領土です

translation.en: and tethered to said lands is not--
translation.ja: サリカ国はフランク族の領土です

translation.en: not therefore legally bound or adherent at all, in fact,
translation.ja: つまりフランス領とは法的に認められていません

translation.en: to the lands of France, but to those of Francia,
translation.ja: つまりフランス領とは法的に認められていません ドイツ領のエルベ川とザール川の間です

translation.en: which, as you know, lies between the rivers of Elbe and Saale.
translation.ja: ドイツ領のエルベ川とザール川の間です

translation.en: I claim here, with proof, that hence it follows that the law Salic,
translation.ja: ここに証拠をもって― フランスの主権が―

translation.en: which has seen French sovereignty stolen as such from a true lineage--
translation.ja: 真の血統から盗まれたものと主張します

translation.en: Thrice, as I can illuminate, the French have cited the law Salic
translation.ja: フランスはサリカ法を利用し女系継承を禁じ…

translation.en: -as reason to bar a female succession-- -With reverence.
translation.ja: フランスはサリカ法を利用し女系継承を禁じ… 大司教

translation.en: Yes, my liege?
I'm finding this story impossible to follow.
My liege, I question the so-called French king's claim
translation.ja: 陛下 私はフランス王の主張に疑義を呈しています

translation.en: to the throne upon which he sits.
translation.ja: 私はフランス王の主張に疑義を呈しています

translation.en: Is that so?  What confuses me now is why you are telling me this story.
translation.ja: そうなのか？　ならばなぜその話を私にする？

translation.ja: 武力衝突した場合のフランスへの主張です

translation.en: And you believe that need will indeed soon arise?
translation.ja: すぐに そのときが来ると？

translation.en: My liege...
by way of preparedness,
translation.ja: これは準備です賢明なのは…

translation.en: -I believe it always wise-- -Preparedness?
translation.ja: これは準備です賢明なのは… 準備？

translation.en: If we are to war with France, it will not come as a consequence of an old and impenetrable madrigal.
translation.ja: フランスと戦うなど正気ではない

translation.en: France was your father's long-held ambition.
translation.ja: 父君の長年の野望です

translation.en: Had he not been bogged in civil feud,
translation.ja: 諸侯の反乱がなければ―

translation.en: he would most surely have taken the fight to her.
translation.ja: 父君はフランスと戦った

translation.en: And then... on to Jerusalem.
Jerusalem?
We're all the way to the Holy Land, are we?
And presumably to sack the rest of Christendom along the way.
translation.ja: そしてキリスト教世界を破壊するのか？

translation.en: I am not my father, archbishop.
I would have thought this to be clear by now.
[William] We must forgive our archbishop.
translation.ja: 大司教を許さねばなりません

translation.en: He is a far...
[exhales] far from gifted orator.
Which is strange, given I would have thought gifted oratory to be a requirement of the position.
translation.ja: 大司教が雄弁家である必要はない

translation.en: Why is the archbishop speaking to me of war with France?
translation.ja: なぜ彼はフランスのことを？

translation.en: What we are witnessing is a stirring,
translation.ja: 何やら不穏な動きがあります

translation.en: of which we must be wary.
I applaud... your restraint.
translation.ja: 陛下は よく冷静でいられた

translation.en: After so many years of strife,
translation.ja: 長年にわたる不和でしたが―

translation.en: you are proving to be more than your father's son.
translation.ja: 陛下は父君を凌駕(りょうが)しつつあります

translation.en: You wish to be a king for the people.
Now, we must ensure to that end, however, you do not remain oblivious to the mood
translation.ja: それには人民の気分を推し測ることが―

translation.en: of the people.
And what mood is this?
That France is taunting us.
Do you share this mood?
this mood is a fantasy.
But that does not mean it is not felt true.
-[Beale] Where are you going? -[Falstaff groans] Disgusting.
-No, we can't be going to Hooper's. -Yes, we can.
-No, she won't have you. -Yes, she will.
-You're not welcome here. -[grunts]
Unless you've come to pay me what you owe me.
[Falstaff] I have paid you.
You've paid me a snatch of what you owe.
translation.ja: あんなのは端金(はしたがね)だね

translation.en: And I presume, too, from the proceeds of thieving.
[Falstaff] Lies.
By all account, you be not specially good at thieving neither.
translation.ja: あんたは盗みが下手だ

translation.en: Lies.
How dare you address me so?
translation.ja: 何で俺に そう絡む？

translation.en: Why would you be so churlish with the very man most likely to lift you from your stinking rat hole?
translation.ja: お前の救世主に向かってなぜ そう突っかかるんだ？

translation.en: Oh, maybe you've forgot.
My associations now stretch to the highest reaches of the realm.
translation.ja: 俺の友人は今や国の頂点だ

translation.en: Your insolence might as well be directed to the king himself.
translation.ja: 無礼な態度は許されないぞ

translation.en: Ponder that now.
[Hooper] Are you speaking of Hal?
Where is he?
-[Falstaff exhales] -Where is Hal? Oh. Where's our king?
translation.ja: ハルは？　王様はどこよ？

translation.en: He be gone weeks and weeks now. Where is he?
-[clears throat] -I would say... -[sighs] -you be the one that's been forgot.
translation.ja: あんたなんかとっくに忘れられてる

translation.en: -Oh. -I would say that your dalliance with the upper reaches of the realm
translation.ja: 国の頂点にいるあんたのお知り合いは―

translation.en: was short-lived in and around his stinking sick bucket.
translation.ja: ほんの束の間悪臭を放つバケツといただけ

translation.en: Seems you were little more than passing keeper of a prince's puke.
translation.ja: あんたは そのゲロを始末してただけさ

translation.en: Ponder that now.
Nell, Sir John is down on his luck.
I am not.

translation.ja: 誰か金づるを見つけなあたしはお断りだ

translation.en: [man] Head.

He seeks asylum in return for his tale.
translation.ja: 情報と引き換えに亡命を

[in French] It can be arranged.
I have been sent by the King of France to assassinate you.
translation.ja: 〈フランス王があなたの暗殺を〉

translation.en: Charles himself sent you?
You know this to be certain?
[Gilrich] The order's origin I know, yes.
From the King.
What was the order?
That I should kill the King of England.
How?
There are many ways to kill a man.
It is my talent...
killing men who do not expect to be killed.
[in English] At such a time as I endeavor to foster a fresh and peaceful air for this kingdom to breathe,
translation.ja: 私は国が呼吸できる平和な空気を育んでいる

translation.en: it is not in my interest to stir hostility with another.
translation.ja: 他人の敵意に興味はない

[William] We share your longing for peace, my liege,
translation.ja: 我々も平和への希求こそあれ―

translation.ja: このような敵意を無視すれば弱点とみなされます

translation.en: This is no game ball. This is an assassin.
translation.ja: これはボールではなく暗殺

translation.ja: 長官　私を弱虫だと？

translation.en: No.
No, I speak more of the kingdom. What the kingdom sees.
translation.ja: 私は国の視点で話しています

translation.ja: 足元の鼬(いたち)を国はどう見てる？

translation.en: If France's animus towards you runs deep enough for them to send an assassin,
translation.ja: フランスの憎悪が暗殺者を送るほどなら―

translation.en: it will be felt in the street, ours and theirs. It will be known.
translation.ja: その敵意を国中が知ることになります

translation.en: We share your concerns.
But peace today needs more than harmony.
translation.ja: しかし平和には調和だけでなく―

translation.en: It needs strength... and confidence.
translation.ja: 強さと自信が必要です

translation.en: These are qualities that can originate only in you,
translation.ja: これは陛下だけに由来する資質

translation.en: the king.
Our king.
Take down these words...
addressed to King Charles of France.
This assassin you send can be taken as nothing other than an infant act of war.
translation.ja: “貴殿が送った暗殺者は幼稚な戦争行為”

translation.en: If this be your intention, I say you let it be known plainly
translation.ja: “これが貴殿の意向ならそれを明白にし―”

translation.en: and that you desist from this timorous slither in which you presently engage.
translation.ja: “臆病な悪巧みを取りやめることだ”

translation.en: If it be war you seek, send the full weight of your army.
translation.ja: “戦争を望むのなら全軍あげて攻撃せよ”

translation.en: For a lone, cowardly assassin
will not topple this King Henry the Fifth of England you so underestimate.
translation.ja: “このヘンリー五世は倒せない”

translation.en: Fill this with gunstones and send it back to France.
translation.ja: 砲弾を詰めて送り返せ

translation.ja: 誰だ？ フランス人です

About what?
[man] He wouldn't say, sire.
I asked of him, he wouldn't say.

translation.ja: わが王は信頼できる人物と慎重な議論をしたいと

translation.en: What discussion?
He believes there is discussion to be had about your new king of England.
translation.ja: イングランドの新王について

We knew not where to turn about what was spoken to us.
translation.ja: 話を聞いたがどうしていいものか

Our king is of low repute.
The French king... teaches you this?
translation.ja: フランス王の入れ知恵か？

translation.en: Is he not thankful for our young Henry's light reaction to his provocation?
translation.ja: 挑発に乗らなかった陛下をシャルルは恨んでるのか？

translation.en: The assassin he swears he knows not of.
translation.ja: 暗殺者を知らないそうだ

translation.en: 'Tis a charge he denies.
His plot came to naught. Of course he would wish to wipe his hands of it.
translation.ja: シャルルは陰謀を否定したい

translation.en: [Cambridge] Whatever the root, they have expressed grave concern
translation.ja: 発端がどうであれ彼らは重大な懸念を抱いてる

translation.en: regarding our king's mental fortitude.
This envoy is to be trusted, is he not, Cambridge?
translation.ja: その使者は？ケンブリッジ伯

translation.en: I believe so.
Charles wishes to dethrone our king.
translation.ja: シャルルは陛下の退位を

translation.en: The issue is not France.
translation.ja: 問題はフランスではない

translation.en: This is but a reminder to us of a more general lunacy.
A boy who but weeks ago was a drunken boor from the sewers of Eastcheap now wears England's crown.
translation.ja: 下水道で酔ってた少年が王冠を被っているんだ

translation.en: -Hmm. -[Grey] What shall become of us?
What shall become of us when civil misdeeds are forgiven as if they were but indiscretions?
translation.ja: 民の悪行が許されたら我々はどうなる？

translation.en: -When traitors-- -Yes, yes, Lord Grey, your--
Your concerns are current.
And they are numerous.
Something must be done. Something will be done.
translation.ja: 手遅れになる前に何とかせねば

translation.en: Give me quiet.
[William] Thus is a king's burden.
A king must make decisions  lesser men are...
translation.ja: 王は決断せねばなりません

translation.en: neither willing nor able to make.
translation.ja: 能力のない者に決断などできない

translation.en: A king is indeed presented with quandaries lesser men might never encounter in the course of their whole lives.
translation.ja: 人生 稀(まれ)にみる難問が王に提示されるのです

translation.en: I wish it were not so.
But problems...
And this is my experience. Problems that are left unattended...
translation.ja: 私の経験から言うと放置されてる問題こそ―

translation.en: have a habit of becoming crises.
You have a chance here to unite the land, Hal.
translation.ja: 今こそ国を統一するとき

translation.en: Truly.
You have refreshed its mood with promise. But promise must be fulfilled.
translation.ja: 陛下の約束で活気は戻ったしかし約束とは果たすもの

translation.en: Promise can never be an end in itself.
translation.ja: 約束だけでは終われない

translation.en: As of this day, we're at war with France.
Twice I have given her the benefit of my doubt.
translation.ja: 私は二度 警告した

translation.en: This third affront will not be left unchecked.
And so, in order to flush these French rats from their nests,
translation.ja: フランスの鼠(ねずみ)を巣から一掃する

translation.en: I will have it communicated to them that we are now at war.
translation.ja: フランスに開戦を伝えてもらおう

translation.en: My Lord Grey.
Cambridge.

translation.ja: この伝言をフランスに届けてほしい

translation.en: familiarity with its recipient.
translation.ja: 受取人とは親しいはず

translation.en: But I believe in the morning you be otherwise engaged.
translation.ja: しかし明日 お前には用事が

translation.en: Pray how, my liege?
Tomorrow you will have your heads cut off.
I have chosen to send you as an advance party to Hell
translation.ja: お前を地獄の宴に送ってやる

translation.en: for the considerable French number that will soon be needing to find space there.
translation.ja: 大勢のフランス人も続くだろう

translation.en: You were once my friend.
I am your friend...
cousin.
All leave.
Now.
You.
Stay.
You...
leave.
This is my place.

I will not jump to your attention.
[inhales] And surely not to retread vile ground I vowed never to walk again.
translation.ja: 不快な地面は二度と踏まないと誓った

translation.en: I acknowledge my neglect of you, John.
A new chapter of my life has begun before the last could be properly closed.
translation.ja: 私は中途半端なまま新たな人生を始めた

translation.en: These concerns are mine and mine alone.
But the fact that this here be the first occasion I've had to sound them aloud to anyone other than myself speaks volumes.
translation.ja: 自分以外の人間に語るのは初めてのような気がする

translation.en: It speaks to the loneliness of the position in which I find myself.
translation.ja: 私がいかに孤独かということだ

translation.en: To steer our present course, I've been forced to rely upon the counsel of men whose loyalty I question every waking moment.
translation.ja: 国の舵をとるために忠誠を疑う臣下に頼ってる

translation.en: Every waking moment.
I need men around me I can trust.
translation.ja: 信頼できる男が欲しい

translation.en: I'm here because you are my friend.

A king has only... followers... and foe.
translation.ja: 王にいるのは従者と敵だけだ

translation.en: I'm sorry my occasion to visit...
carries with it this doleful weight.
translation.ja: 不愉快な思いをさせた

translation.en: Hal.
I will come with you. I ask only one favor in return.
translation.ja: お前と一緒に行こうだが一つ頼みがある

translation.en: [exhales] Square my account with that terrible hag... over there. Would you?
translation.ja: このクソばばあに俺のツケを払ってくれ

translation.en: [King Henry V] We welcome those newly arrived here.
translation.ja: 諸卿　よく来てくれた

translation.en: Turn us now in common poise, with one mind, sharpened.
translation.ja: 心を一つにして準備にかかろう

translation.en: Together... we will bring France down.
translation.ja: 力を合わせフランスを倒す

translation.en: Together... we will bring her to her knees.
translation.ja: 我らに ひざまずかせるのだ

translation.ja: 新たな指揮官を紹介する

translation.en: Sir John Falstaff.
translation.ja: ジョン･フォルスタッフ卿

translation.en: Sir John's experience in battle should need no recitation. You know of him.
translation.ja: 彼の戦果は今さら言うまでもない

translation.en: Some of you have had the honor of fighting alongside him.
translation.ja: ともに戦った者もいるはずだ

translation.ja: 彼に同行を求めたのには訳がある

translation.en: he respects war as only a man who has seen its most monstrous form can.
translation.ja: 彼は戦争の真の恐ろしさを知ってる

translation.en: He lusts after it not,

translation.ja: 諸卿が求める正しい判断が下せるのだ

translation.en: Welcome, and thank you... [inhales] good sirs.
translation.ja: よく来てくれた諸卿には礼を言う

translation.en: You're all well met.
Very good.

One is never ready for what awaits us.
translation.ja: そんな容易(たやす)いものか？

translation.en: You believe Sir John there to be fit and suitable enough to captain this effort?
translation.ja: 陛下は あの男が指揮官に適切であると？

translation.en: John is a good man.

We shall know soon enough.
You must rest.
John.
Thank you.
What for?
For being here.
With me.
Well, it's a small price to pay to keep that detestable Hooper woman off me back.
translation.ja: 大したことはない女将から逃げられた

[man 1] Check every building.
[man 2] No man!

translation.ja: 城の包囲には何ヵ月もかかる場合も

translation.en: Men in these numbers, fixed here,
will fall to hunger and disease.
Sir John.

translation.ja: 確かに戦は…無情で残忍だ

translation.ja: 敵の投降をのんびり待ってるのか？

translation.ja: それこそ包囲攻撃の定義

translation.ja: いつまで待つ？ 分からぬか

translation.ja: それも包囲戦の特徴だ

translation.ja: 兵は出さぬ なぜです？

translation.ja: 私は一か八かで兵を犠牲にはできん

translation.ja: 籠城してるなら迂回して進めばいい

translation.en: So well versed in the art of warfare.
translation.ja: 戦術に精通しておられる

translation.ja: イングランドからの補給線の―

translation.ja: 私は この遠征の財政支援者

translation.ja: 今日は ここまでです

translation.ja: 〈貴殿は今夜立ち退きを見届け―〉

translation.ja: ここに皇太子が向かってます

translation.ja: 父王が降伏する話だといいんだが

translation.ja: 皇太子に構わず進軍の準備を

translation.en: and bury it under a tree.
A little French tree.
translation.ja: 小さなフランスの木だ

translation.en: Very young, very small.
translation.ja: まだ若くて とても小さい

translation.en: Since perchance that is fitting of your mind for you to come here.
translation.ja: まるで お前の心のように

translation.en: Small.
And maybe your...
I mean, no, your balls must be big, no?
translation.ja: タマ(ボール)は大きいのか？

translation.en: Giant balls.
Giant balls... with a tiny cock.
translation.ja: 巨大なタマに小さなペニス

translation.en: And the sound of your wives and children weeping
translation.ja: お前の妻子のすすり泣いてる声が―

translation.en: shall lull me to sleep at night.
Have you heard what I said?
I have.
It was stirring.
Sir John, please walk with me.
Good night.
Ready the men to move.
Waste no time.
[boy] Run!
Hello, little boy.
Don't be afraid. Don't be afraid.
I want you to deliver a gift to your king.
translation.ja: お前の王に贈り物を届けてほしいんだ

translation.en: Will you do this for me?
Good boy.
Double the guards to 20 yards through the night. Three hours at a watch.
translation.ja: 夜の歩哨(ほしょう)を倍に３時間交代だ

translation.en: I want these men fresh and alert. Any man caught sleeping will have his eyes gouged.
translation.ja: 油断して眠った者は目玉をえぐり出す

translation.en: Any caught speaking will lose his tongue.
And I want all French prisoners in our train put to death.
translation.ja: フランスの捕虜は処刑しろ

translation.en: Leave their corpses speared on pikes by the river's edge.
translation.ja: 槍で突き刺し 川に捨てよ

translation.en: [Falstaff] The first command I'll heed.
translation.ja: 最初の命令は了解した

translation.en: The second...
you'll have to carry out that mass execution yourself.
translation.ja: 王自らが実行すべきだ

translation.en: What did you say to me?
You are not that man.
How dare you defy me?
Show your feeling in here, with me.
-Don't let it outside this tent. -How dare you defy me? I am the king.
And where is the fearsome old warrior Falstaff about whom I've heard so much?
translation.ja: お前は最強の戦士だったはずだ

translation.en: You've been mute since we crossed the sea.
I seem to be serving as my own chief tactician, my own commander, my own counsel.
translation.ja: 私の戦術家で指揮官なのに

translation.en: Where is the fearsome old warrior Falstaff?!
I speak only when there's something to be said.
Too often have I seen men of war invent work for themselves,
translation.ja: 戦になると人間は余分な仕事を作り出す

translation.en: work that leads to nothing but vainglory and slaughtered men.
translation.ja: 何の意味もない虐殺とかだ

translation.en: I'm not that man.
And this here is the war that you have chosen to wage.
translation.ja: これは お前の戦争だ

translation.en: I will disembowel you right here with mine own hand.
You are not that man, either.
Lord Dorset, summon your fastest rider.
translation.ja: ドーセット卿最速の乗り手を

translation.en: My liege.
Dartmouth!
[panting] Sires. What can I do for you?
Tell me what lies over that hill. Ride fast, return directly.
translation.ja: 丘の向こうを偵察してこい

translation.en: We are both outnumbered and out-positioned.
They have the downslope in their favor. Our need to advance puts us already at disadvantage.
translation.ja: 敵は有利な下り坂で我々は進むのも難しい

translation.en: The longer we wait, the larger their force will grow, and with it, our disadvantage.
translation.ja: 待てば待つほど不利になる

translation.en: Your archers, my lord, are of superior faculty.
French crossbow is no match for an English longbow.
translation.ja: 長弓は敵の石弓に勝る

translation.en: We should hobble their number on first assault by these means alone.
translation.ja: 先制して敵の数を減らす

translation.en: York's charge in center faces four lines of mounted knights. Our archers here might weaken those by half. But--
translation.ja: 対峙する騎馬隊が四列なら半数は仕留められます

translation.en: But not eight lines.
Nine. Ten. More.
You speak true, my liege. The longer we wait, the greater our disadvantage.
translation.ja: 待てば不利になるのは事実

translation.en: But it is possible our disadvantage has already grown insurmountable.
translation.ja: しかし事態はすでに克服しがたい

translation.en: A great many men are already desperately ill and weak from hunger.
translation.ja: 多くの兵士が病と飢えに苦しんでます

translation.en: What then, my lord, do you propose we do?
translation.ja: では どうしろと言うのだ？

translation.en: I propose we consider turning back, my liege.
[stammers] I know it will not bring the outcome we desire, but nor will the evisceration of our army.
translation.ja: このままでは勝利どころか全滅します

translation.en: I'm reticent to speak for others here now,
translation.ja: この恐怖は私ばかりか―

translation.en: but I'm certain my fears are shared.
Who here agrees with Lord Dorset?
You can win this battle.
[Dorset] Is that so, Sir John?
Yes.
And precisely how is that so, Sir John?
You fight without horses and without armor.
translation.ja: 馬も鎧(よろい)も捨てて戦う

translation.en: Heavens above, please spare us from this man.
[Falstaff] Their forward defense is a front line of mounted men.
translation.ja: 敵の前方防衛は騎馬隊の最前線

translation.en: Many deep. Knights all.
All on horseback, all with heavy armor.
translation.ja: 全員が馬上で重装甲だ

translation.en: The ground out there... is a flood bowl, already half-sodden.
translation.ja: あの土地は洪水が多くすでに半分がぬかるんでる

translation.en: When it rains tonight, as I know it will,
that ground will turn into a muddy bog.
translation.ja: あそこは泥濘(でいねい)になる

translation.en: And with their horses and their armor,
they will get stuck, they will fall,
translation.ja: 身動きがとれずに落馬

translation.en: and they will flounder like upturned beetles.
translation.ja: 裏返った甲(かぶと)虫だ

translation.en: As shall we.
Not if we travel light, without horses and without armor.
translation.ja: 馬も鎧も捨てた軽装備ならどうだ？

translation.en: Speed and mobility will be our advantage.
translation.ja: 速さと機動性が利点になる

translation.en: [Westmorland] And how, Sir John,
can you be so sure of rainfall tonight?
translation.ja: なぜ今夜 雨が降ると？

translation.en: My right knee is aching. It only does that when rain is near.
translation.ja: 雨が降りそうだと右膝が痛むんだ

translation.en: Oh, save us, my liege. Please put a stop to this drivel.
This would require their armored front line come meet us in the mud. How do you propose we invite that?
translation.ja: 敵を泥濘の中にどうやっておびき寄せる？

translation.en: A small forward armored attack of our own.
A false advance.
They will counter.
We save our weight and our muscle for a nimble assault from the flanks.
translation.ja: 我々は側面攻撃のための力を温存する

translation.en: They shan't be so easily deceived. They will not respond to false attack.
translation.ja: 敵が偽の攻撃に反応するとは思えん

translation.en: They will respond.
We move, they will meet us in the mud.
Our men-at-arms are outnumbered. This they know.
They will hope to overwhelm us, so they will meet us with full force,
translation.ja: 我々を制圧すべくどんな小隊だろうと―

translation.en: no matter how small our first advance.
Our great longbows will rain chaos on them from above.
translation.ja: そのとき我々の長弓が雨と降り注ぐ

translation.en: That chaos will be your favor.
My liege, I implore you, we mustn't... we mustn't listen to this madness.
translation.ja: 陛下　耳を傾けてはなりません

translation.en: What is the true experience of this man?
He once fought for Richard many years ago.
translation.ja: 戦ったのは はるか昔

translation.en: Since then, he has done nothing...
translation.ja: それ以来 何もせず―

translation.en: other than ride with the companies, robbing and tormenting.
translation.ja: 仲間とつるんで盗みを働いていた

translation.en: I never robbed anyone who didn't deserve to be robbed.
translation.ja: 俺は善人からは盗んでない

translation.en: If it rains tonight, we fight tomorrow.
translation.ja: 今夜 雨が降ったら明日が決戦だ

translation.en: If you have concocted this plan, half-baked and speculative,
translation.ja: これが不完全な作戦であり―

translation.en: merely to prove to me your worth,
please say so now.
All plans are speculative.
And as I say, I only speak them when I feel them true.
translation.ja: 俺は本物だと感じたときだけ話す

translation.en: This one I feel in my bones.
This one I feel in my knee bone.
Here we are on the eve of this fight, and I am...
translation.ja: こうして戦いの前夜に―

translation.en: I am scared to wonder, to tell it true,
translation.ja: どうしてここにいるのか―

translation.en: why we are here.
You best discover the answer for that.
The men out there deserve it.
They've given their lives to you.
I cannot say what forces have conspired to bring you here,
translation.ja: 誰かの策謀の末の戦争でも―

translation.en: but these men need you, just as you need them.
translation.ja: 兵士には王が王には兵士が必要だ

translation.en: These men deserve your confidence.
And if you cannot give them that, at least then tell them a magnificent lie.
translation.ja: 答えが与えられないときは壮大な嘘をつけ

translation.en: Though you might not think it possible...
you are my friend.
Good night, Hal.
Sleep well.
This wind whips from the north.
The rain was sent from England.
translation.ja: 雨はイングランドから

translation.en: Why are you being fitted with plate? We were to fight without armor.
translation.ja: 鎧を脱いで戦うのではないのか？

translation.en: We need a front line to draw them in.
It cannot be you.
[Falstaff] The idea was mine.
Some man must lead the first push to sell it well.
translation.ja: 俺が先導して兵を引っ張る

translation.en: My men have been assembled.
And I cannot, in good conscience, send them out there to realize my speculative drivel
translation.ja: 俺が一緒に泥だらけにならずして―

translation.en: without getting muddy alongside them, can I?
I will fight with you.
[inhales] It's noble, but you know that cannot be.
This is what I was built for.
I die here or... I die over a bottle in Eastcheap.
translation.ja: ここで死ぬかあの居酒屋で死ぬかだ

translation.en: And I think this makes for a much better story.
translation.ja: こっちの方がいいだろ

translation.en: And you have things still to do.
You will join this fight.
But promise me you don't join too early.
translation.ja: 早まった参入はするな

translation.en: It doesn't matter what you see out there.
We must first draw them all in. All of them.
translation.ja: まず おびき寄せる

translation.en: Promise me that, Hal.
Win, my friend.
Maybe then you'll lighten enough to have a drink with me. Hmm?
[in French] Where is the Dauphin?
I humbly thank you for receiving me, noble lord.
[in English] Please. Please speak English.
translation.ja: どうぞ英語で話してくれ

translation.en: I enjoy to speak English.
translation.ja: 英語を話すのは楽しい

translation.en: It is simple... and ugly.
I have been waiting all morning,
all the night... for your surrender.
translation.ja: お前が降伏するときを

translation.en: It might have saved a great unease had it come sooner.
translation.ja: もっと早く来れば不安も拭えたろうに

translation.en: I know you do not speak for your father.
I do speak for my father.
I know you do not speak for your father, so I come to you now directly.
translation.ja: それは偽り故に会いに来た

translation.en: I have not come to surrender.
Too much Christian blood will be spilled on this field today.
So, I propose this:
You and I fight, one man on one man. We fight in our armies' stead.
translation.ja: 兵士に代わって貴方と一騎打ちがしたい

translation.en: If I lose, my men will leave this place forthwith and forever. You will have my head.
translation.ja: 私が負けたら兵は撤退この首を貴方に

translation.en: If I win, I will assume this kingdom's crown upon your father's death.
translation.ja: 私が勝ったらこの国の跡継ぎになる

translation.en: What say you?
Are you scared, young Henry?
translation.ja: 怖いのか？　ヘンリー

translation.en: What say you?
Are you scared of this battle? There is no shame of it.
translation.ja: 戦が怖いのか？恥じることはない

translation.en: Save your men.
You save your own men.
You came here. To me!
translation.ja: お前は私に会いに来た

translation.en: [yells] Surrender to me!
I cannot do that.
[Dauphin] Well, then, boy,
let us make famous... that field out there.
translation.ja: では ここを名だたる地にしよう

translation.en: This little village of Agincourt,
translation.ja: このアジャンクールに―

translation.en: that will forever mark the site of your callow disgrace.
translation.ja: お前の汚名を刻印してやる

translation.en: You expect of me a speech?
I have only one to give,
and it is the same one I'd give were we not standing on the brim of a battlefield.
translation.ja: 私は戦場以外でもこの言葉を与える

translation.en: It is the same one I'd give were we to meet in the street by chance.
translation.ja: ここが通りでも同じことだ

translation.en: I have only ever hoped for one thing...
to see this kingdom united under this English crown.
translation.ja: わが国に統一されるのを見たい

translation.en: All men are born to die. We know it.
We carry it with us always.
If your day be today, so be it.
translation.ja: それが今日なら殉じろ

translation.en: Mine will be tomorrow.
Or mine today and yours tomorrow. It matters not.
translation.ja: あるいは逆かもしれぬ

translation.en: What matters is that you know, in your hearts, that today you are that kingdom united. You are England.
translation.ja: 王国は統一されたも同じ諸君こそイングランドだ

translation.en: Each and every one of you. England is you.
translation.ja: イングランドは諸君なのだ

translation.en: And it is the space between you.
Fight not for yourselves, fight for that space.
translation.ja: この地のために戦ってくれ

translation.en: Fill that space.
Make it tissue. Make it mass.
Make it impenetrable. Make it yours!
Make it England! Make it England!
translation.ja: ここをイングランドにするのだ！

translation.en: Great men to it. Captains, lords. Great men to it!
translation.ja: 偉大なる諸君なら必ずできる！

translation.en: For the King and St. George!
translation.ja: 王のもと いざ突撃だ！

translation.en: [men] For the King and St. George!
Les imbéciles.
Archers.
[man 2] Archers!
[man 3] Archers! Now!
Draw!
Loose!
Halt!
Ready!
Loose!
On me!
Come then...
King of England.
Hail the King. Hail the King.
Hail the King.
-Hail the King. -Hail King Henry.
[Westmorland] My liege. The prisoners we have took are a rabble.
translation.ja: 陛下　捕らえた者たちは暴徒です

translation.en: I fear we will not secure them should their army regroup.
translation.ja: 生かせば部隊の再編成を

translation.en: Kill them all.
[in French] Your Majesty... Henry, King of England.
translation.ja: 〈陛下　イングランド王ヘンリーです〉

translation.en: [in English] Your Majesty...
Come sit here with me.
Please.
I like to have the sun on my skin, but not too much.
translation.ja: 太陽に肌をさらすのはほんの一時

translation.en: Too much is very dangerous.
This conversation we are about to have... has been had many times before,
translation.ja: こうした話し合いは以前に何度も経験した

translation.en: and will be had many times again for centuries to come
translation.ja: 一方には虚栄心一方には正当な理由

translation.en: between men of vanity and men of good reason.
translation.ja: この先 何世紀も同じことが続くだろう

translation.en: I would hope that you and I are men of good reason.
translation.ja: 我々にも正当な理由があるといいが

translation.en: I have, of course, traveled here to offer you my surrender.
translation.ja: 私は降伏するためにここまでやってきた

translation.en: Do you ask anything of me in return?
No.
I do, however, have for you a proposition.
translation.ja: とはいえ陛下に私から お願いがある

translation.en: You take the hand of my daughter,
translation.ja: どうか娘の手をとってくれ

translation.en: Catherine,
in marriage.
It is most uncanny...
that the great movements of history
so frequently find their origins in the minutia of family.
translation.ja: たどれば家族の些末なことから始まる

translation.en: That in ways I dare not unsettle here,
my relationship with my son and yours... with your father.
translation.ja: 私と息子の関係　そして陛下と父君の関係が―

translation.en: These are the things that have led us here today.
translation.ja: 今日 私たちをここに導いた

translation.en: We are leaders of lands and peoples,
translation.ja: 我々は国や人民の指導者だが―

translation.en: and yet... it is family that moves us.
translation.ja: 我々を動かすのは家族なのだ

translation.en: Family... consumes us.
translation.ja: 家族は我々を食い尽くす

translation.en: My condolences to you... for the loss of your friend, Sir John.
translation.ja: 友人ジョン卿の死に哀悼の意を捧げます

translation.en: I know you must feel this loss deeply.
translation.ja: 心からお悔やみ申し上げる

translation.en: Thank you, William.
Your loyalty to me has been comforting.
You have proven yourself to be a most worthy king.
translation.ja: 陛下は その力を証明された

translation.en: I would say you have proven yourself to be one of England's great kings.
translation.ja: 偉大なイングランド王になられたのです

translation.en: [Lord Chamberlain] Your Majesty, the crowd has gathered.
translation.ja: 陛下　民衆が集まっております

translation.en: So I hear.
[in French] Leave us.
Please sit, Your Majesty.
[in French] You are beautiful.
Merci.
I will no longer speak French.
We must speak English.
I cannot speak English.
You will learn.
I wonder, then, how our union might proceed in the meantime.
translation.ja: 〈私たちの結婚はどうなるのでしょう？〉

translation.en: [in English] There is much I wonder about a great many things.
[in English] Indeed there must be for you
translation.ja: 見知らぬ女と結婚することを―

translation.en: to contemplate marriage to a woman about whom...
translation.ja: 見知らぬ女と結婚することを― 陛下は熟慮せねばなりません

translation.en: you know so little.
translation.ja: 陛下は熟慮せねばなりません

translation.en: I will not submit to you. You must earn my respect.
translation.ja: 私は服従しません尊敬を勝ち取ってください

translation.en: I understand that.
Do you?
I do.
Do you feel a sense of achievement?
In what regard?
In any regard.
I have achieved that which my father never could. I have united this kingdom in common cause.
translation.ja: 私は父ができなかった国の統一を成し遂げた

translation.en: You have achieved momentary respite.
translation.ja: 一時の休息を得たのですね

translation.en: A unity forged under false pretense will never be a unity that prevails.
translation.ja: でも偽りによる統一は弱いものです

translation.en: How, pray, have my endeavors been forged falsely?
translation.ja: 私が騙されたと言うのか？

translation.en: Why did you bring war to France?
Your father came on spoiling.
How so? How was he spoiling?
He sent an assassin.
There was no assassin.
There was no plot to kill you.
How might you know?
Because I was with my father when he received word of your charge.
translation.ja: 陛下の伝言を読む父のそばに

translation.en: I know him well enough to know his reaction to be genuine.
translation.ja: 父の反応は本物でした

translation.en: How was his reaction?
He laughed.
He laughed very much. He said you must be drunk.
Your father is a madman.
He may be mad, but he is true.
His madness makes him true. He says only what he believes.
translation.ja: 本当のことしか言わない

translation.en: That is why he is loved.
The assassin then was sent by your brother.
-My brother? -Mm-hmm. My brother was too stupid to conjure such a plan.
translation.ja: 兄上は愚かとても陰謀など

translation.en: What was your true reason?
Did you know of the ball he sent?
The ball he sent to me?
A ball?
He sent to you...
-a ball? -Why should you question my intent?
translation.ja: 兄が陛下にボールを？ なぜ疑問を投げかける？

translation.en: Your father's rule is illegitimate. He has no right claim to his throne.
translation.ja: そなたの父の統治は非合法だ

translation.en: All monarchy is illegitimate.
You yourself are the son of a usurper.
It would seem that you have no explanation for what you have done.
translation.ja: ご自分は何をなされたのです？

translation.en: You have shed the blood of so many Christian souls, and yet...
translation.ja: 大勢のキリスト教徒を殺(あや)めた

translation.en: before me now, all I see is a... young and vain and foolish man so easily riled.
translation.ja: でも私の前にいる陛下は若く苛(いら)立つ愚かな男です

translation.en: So easily beguiled.
I must leave you now.
[William] Gentle.
We must be sure to revel in this day, my friend.
translation.ja: 今日を大いに楽しみましょう

translation.en: A crowd has gathered in honor of our victory.
translation.ja: 勝利を祝して民衆が集まりました

translation.en: These are the rare moments for which a king truly lives, I would imagine.
translation.ja: 王が人生を享受する稀な瞬間です

translation.en: In all my preoccupation, I have... neglected to ask after your family.
translation.ja: お前の家族のことを聞いてなかったな

translation.en: Your preoccupations are hardly trifling.
translation.ja: 陛下は お忙しい身です

translation.en: You have two sons.
I do.
[King Henry V] And...
your wife minds your estate in your absence.
translation.ja: 主人の留守を預かってる

translation.en: [William] She does.
Yours is sheep.
You're a man of wool.
As was my father before me.
How many head?
At last count, some 4,000. Mostly Dorset Horns.
translation.ja: ドーセットホーンが4000頭ばかり

translation.en: How much land have you?
To be true, I'm not... wholly certain, but...
translation.ja: 正直言いますと定かではありません

translation.en: but many... many hundreds of beautiful, beautiful acres.
translation.ja: しかし美しい数百エーカーです

translation.en: What lands in France have you now annexed?
[William] Stop.
Now that France is ours, how much of her land is now yours?
translation.ja: かの地をどれだけ所有する？

translation.en: That has yet to be determined. [chuckles]
Your conquest is so recent.
-Why do you ask this question-- -Stay up there.
-Hmm? -Stay up there.
How did my assassin come to you?
translation.ja: 暗殺者は なぜお前に？

translation.en: I fail to remember the moment.
translation.ja: 記憶が曖昧(あいまい)で

translation.en: Remedy this failure.
So much has happened in the intervening months.
An event as pivotal as this one should be amply equipped to penetrate the fog of time elapsed.  No?
translation.ja: これほど重要なことは経過を明らかにせねばならん

translation.en: Of course.
Let me recall.
Was it in the street?
Did he come to you in the street?
Yes. Yes, it was in the street. He approached me... [inhales] most unusually.
translation.ja: そうだ　通りでした突然 声をかけられた

translation.en: My liege, please, tell me the cause of this concern.
translation.ja: 陛下　何を心配なされてる？

translation.en: Stay up there.
Stay up there.
Did he know your name?
I don't believe he did.
How, then, did he know who you were to approach?
The memory is returning.
He surrendered himself to palace guards and the matter was brought to my attention. I was taken to him.
